alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN ISLE OF WIGHT AND THE CENTRAL CITY OF SUFFOLK THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carrsville, or near Holland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Windsor and Suffolk around 405 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Central Hill, Whitley, Collosse, Longview, Walters, Wills Corner, Boaz, Elwood, Chuckatuck, and Indika. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
